snippet: The cases of four nonviolent offenders sentenced to life without parole illustrate the complaints that rigid formulas for penalties often result in injustice.
abstract: Companion chart to Page One article depicts cases of four prisoners who were handed mandatory sentences of life without parole by judges who did not believe the punishment fit the crime. (Series: Time and Punishment)
lead_paragraph: The cases of four nonviolent offenders sentenced to life without parole illustrate the complaints that rigid formulas for penalties often result in injustice.

headline.seo: Life Without Parole: Four Inmates’ Stories
headline.main: Life Without Parole: Four Inmates’ Stories
headline.print_headline: Life Without Parole: Four Inmates’ Stories
